message: Just wanted to start a discussion on design resources. Things that we may use in our workflows that others may not know about. I'll start with a project of my own - http://tileabl.es which is a collection of seamless textures for your backgrounds. They are free for both personal and commercial use.
Orman Clark's stuff is generally pretty good http://bit.ly/fTFhcB
Speaking of design resources, is there an easier way to preview/manage them? I don't want to load 50 styles when I only want one; load the texture to see it; add the brushes to only use one... etc?

https://www.designersbookshop.com/grid-calculator-pro-edition.html

http://www.thegridsystem.org/  

https://gomockingbird.com/mockingbird/  <--I don't use this, but my friend/coder referred me to it

http://colourlovers.com 

http://kuler.adobe.com

http://afterimage.com

http://www.imageafter.com

I have others but can't think of them.
check out http://rgbjam.com they have some great freebies and tuts, not the regular/usual ones.
